page.title: 03I.C.I. WILTON
page.content: I.C.I.WILTON. _____________ The Imperial Chemical Industries plant at Wilton was started in 1946 to cope with the vast demands for materials to help rebuild Britain after WW2,and is concerned with making products from hydrocarbons(organic chemicals).The site covers about 2000 acres,employs 7000 people and is situated on the South bank of the Tees between Redcar and Eston.It is flat and on boulder clay,making it ideal for supporting heavy buildings,and is also covenient for the nearby Tees Docks. Due to the local steel production,there was a good pool of personnel available to build and maintain a large chemical complex,and coal was available from Durham. Cont.on next page.
